title: go1.4.1 build breaks on ubuntu
body:
I am trying to build go1.4.1 from the latest repo on Ubuntu 14.04.02 x86_64 box

```
$ git checkout go1.4.1
$ cd src
$ ./all.bash
...
...
..
# Checking API compatibility.
Error running hg clone on go.tools: exit status 255
abort: HTTP Error 404: Not Found
exit status 1

```


The cause of the failure seems to be that go tools has been moved from code.google.com to a github repo.

```
~/g/src git:tags/go1.4.1 ❯❯❯ grep -r  "hg clone"                                                                                               ◼
cmd/api/run.go:// else it hg clones it.
cmd/api/run.go:	// cloneDir is where we run "hg clone".
cmd/api/run.go:	os.RemoveAll(tmpDir)   // in case of aborted hg clone before
cmd/api/run.go:		log.Fatalf("Error running hg clone on go.tools: %v\n%s", err, out)

```

Though the above is the last test before the "ALL PASSED" mark, it still results in an unclean build.
